li.a: Online Pre-K and K Registration Form
Employee Technology and Social Media Use

div.style: margin-bottom: -1px; zoom: 1; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(28, 30, 33); font-size: 12px;

div.p: March 13, 2020 brought instant change to all of our lives. Today is serving as another shift in response to the COVID-19 Pandemic. The governor announced that schools will remain closed for the rest of this school year today. We were not informed of this announcement prior to him sharing with the state. We will continue learning and feeding as we have until the last day of school for this year, observing all holidays and days school was not to be in session. Further communication will follow as soon as it is made available to the county school system

We also received word that the evening pickup of meals will not take place at the FRN tonight as originally scheduled. Please go to Project Hope if you were unable to secure food during the daytime distribution.
Thank you for your continued support as we navigate these changes.

span.br: Follow the link below to view the Unleash Tygart interview with Superintendent Miller regarding how COVID-19 is affecting the school system.
